alert.note: Alert for Northern Clearwater Mountains; Southern Clearwater Mountains (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 11 at 6:05PM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Idaho and east central Clearwater Counties through 530 PM PDT... At 504 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 21 miles east of Pierce, or 37 miles northeast of Kamiah, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half-inch size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Idaho and east central Clearwater Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Northern Clearwater Mountains; Southern Clearwater Mountains
